page.title: 15The Retreat Inn, Littleworth
page.content: Placed in picturesque surroundings opposite the old village school, The Retreat Inn was built in 1939. During the war and since it has been used by soldiers from Norton Barracks, by local villagers and others who play Crib, Darts and Skittles there. The Skittles Alley is only two years old and was built by M.G. Cowley in the old function room. The pub sells Marstons Beer and is featured in The Good Beer Guide. The Inn has ample parking space and has chairs in the garden for fine weather drinking. The building has a large slate roof with many chimneys. The outside was originally red brick but has now been painted a mottled grey colour. The Old Retreat Inn was situated in field nearby the present building but is now unused and a ruin.
